$comment: This is based on https://github.com/flywheel-io/gears/blob/master/spec/manifest.schema.json. It is NOT used for validation, just for doc/code gen.

gear-maintainer.description: (optional) The maintainer of this gear. Can be used to distinguish the algorithm author from the gear maintainer.

gear-cite.description: (optional) Any citations relevant to the algorithm(s) or work present in the gear.

gear-config.description: Schema snippets describing the options this gear consumes. Not currently processed.

gear-custom.description: A place for gear authors to put arbitrary information.

gear-description.description: A brief description of the gear's purpose. Ideally 1-4 sentences.

gear-environment.description: Environment variables that should be set for the gear.

gear-command.description: If provided, the starting command for the gear, rather than /flywheel/v0/run. Will be templated according to the spec.

gear-label.description: The human-friendly name of this gear.

gear-uri.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

description.description: Hackaround for description not technically being a schema directive

optional.description: Allow the gear to mark an input file as optional.

gear-inputs.description: Schema snippets describing the inputs this gear consumes.

gear-source.description: The URL where the source code of this gear can be found. Leave blank if none.

gear-url.description: The URL where more information about this gear can be found. Leave blank if none.

gear-version.description: A human-friendly string explaining the release version of this gear. Example: 3.2.1

gear-exchange.description: Metadata object that describes the origin of a gear version

git-commit.description: The SHA-1 hash referring to the git commit

rootfs-hash.description: The cryptographic hash of the root filesystem in the form of "algorithm:<base16 hash>"

rootfs-url.description: The absolute URL of the gear's root file system

gear-doc.description: A full gear description, including manifest and exchange information
